doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Model of Cadence Gigabit Ethernet Controller (GEM). For further details please consult README-EMAC.txt

doctext.name: txt_1
doctext.text: This model is based upon the data and use in the Xilinx Zynq

doctext.name: txt_2
doctext.text: Basic network Tx/Rx functionality tested using Xilinx Linux Kernel using wget and other similar tools

doctext.name: txt_3
doctext.text: Tested with Xilinx SDK Example driver.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Open Source Apache 2.0

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: This model is based upon the data from the Xilinx Zynq platform, other registers may not be included.

doctext.name: txt_1
doctext.text: Does not implement: VLAN, pause frames, filtering or timestamps.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Zynq-7000 TRM (https://www.xilinx.com/support/documentation/user_guides/ug585-Zynq-7000-TRM.pdf)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: IRQ Pin

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The port to connect the packetnet virtual network

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Network Control

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Flush the next packet from the external RX DPRAM. Writing one to this bit will only have an effect if the DMA is not currently writing a packet already stored in the DPRAM to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit PFC Priority Based Pause Frame. Takes the values stored in the Transmit PFC Pause Register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PFC Priority Based Pause Reception capabilities. Setting this bit will enable PFC negotiation and recognition of priority based pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Store receive time stamp to memory. Setting this bit to one will cause the CRC of every received frame to be replaced with the value of the nanoseconds field of the 1588 timer that was captured as the receive frame passed the message time stamp point. Set to zero for normal operation.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit zero quantum pause frame. Writing one to this bit causes a pause frame with zero quantum to be transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit pause frame - writing one to this bit causes a pause frame to be transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit halt - writing one to this bit halts transmission as soon as any ongoing frame transmission ends.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Start transmission - writing one to this bit starts transmission.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Back pressure - if set in 10M or 100M half duplex mode will force collisions on all received frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Write enable for statistics registers - setting this bit to one means the statistics registers can be written for functional test purposes.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Incremental statistics registers - this bit is write only. Writing a one increments all the statistics registers by one for test purposes.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Clear statistics registers - this bit is write only. Writing a one clears the statistics registers.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Management port enable - set to one to enable the management port. When zero forces mdio to high impedance state and mdc low.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit enable - when set, it enables the GEM transmitter to send data. When reset transmission will stop immediately, the transmit pipeline and control registers will be cleared and the transmit queue pointer register will reset to point to the start of the transmit descriptor list.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive enable - when set, it enables the GEM to receive data. When reset frame reception will stop immediately and the receive pipeline will be cleared. The receive queue pointer register is unaffected.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Loop back local - asserts the loopback_local signal to the system clock generator. Also connects txd to rxd, tx_en to rx_dv and forces full duplex mode. Bit 11 of the network configuration register must be set low to disable TBI mode when in internal loopback. rx_clk and tx_clk may malfunction as the GEM is switched into and out of internal loop back. It is important that receive and transmit circuits have already been disabled when making the switch into and out of internal loop back. Local loopback functionality isn't available in the EP107 Zynq Emulation Platform, because the clocking doesn't map well into an FPGA.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Network Configuration

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Ignore IPG rx_er. When set rx_er has no effect on the GEM's operation when rx_dv is low. Set this when using the RGMII wrapper in half-duplex mode.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive bad preamble. When set frames with non-standard preamble are not rejected.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: IPG stretch enable - when set the transmit IPG can be increased above 96 bit times depending on the previous frame length using the IPG stretch register.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: SGMII mode enable - changes behavior of the auto-negotiation advertisement and link partner ability registers to meet the requirements of SGMII and reduces the duration of the link timer from 10 ms to 1.6 ms

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Ignore RX FCS - when set frames with FCS/CRC errors will not be rejected. FCS error statistics will still be collected for frames with bad FCS and FCS status will be recorded in frame's DMA descriptor. For normal operation this bit must be set to zero.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable frames to be received in half-duplex mode while transmitting.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive checksum offload enable - when set, the receive checksum engine is enabled. Frames with bad IP, TCP or UDP checksums are discarded.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable copy of pause frames - set to one to prevent valid pause frames being copied to memory. When set, pause frames are not copied to memory regardless of the state of the copy all frames bit; whether a hash match is found or whether a type ID match is identified. If a destination address match is found the pause frame will be copied to memory. Note that valid pause frames received will still increment pause statistics and pause the transmission of frames as required.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Data bus width. Only valid bus widths may be written if the system is configured to a maximum width less than 128-bits. Zynq defines gem_dma_bus_width_def as 2'b00. 00: 32 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 01: 64 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 10: 128 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 11: 128 bit AMBA AHB data bus width

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: MDC clock division - set according to cpu_1xclk speed. These three bits determine the number cpu_1xclk will be divided by to generate MDC. For conformance with the 802.3 specification, MDC must not exceed 2.5 MHz (MDC is only active during MDIO read and write operations). 000: divide cpu_1xclk by 8 (cpu_1xclk up to 20 MHz) 001: divide cpu_1xclk by 16 (cpu_1xclk up to 40 MHz) 010: divide cpu_1xclk by 32 (cpu_1xclk up to 80 MHz) 011: divide cpu_1xclk by 48 (cpu_1xclk up to 120MHz) 100: divide cpu_1xclk by 64 (cpu_1xclk up to 160 MHz) 101: divide cpu_1xclk by 96 (cpu_1xclk up to 240 MHz) 110: divide cpu_1xclk by 128 (cpu_1xclk up to 320 MHz) 111: divide cpu_1xclk by 224 (cpu_1xclk up to 540 MHz)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: FCS remove - setting this bit will cause received frames to be written to memory without their frame check sequence (last 4 bytes). The frame length indicated will be reduced by four bytes in this mode.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Length field error frame discard - setting this bit causes frames with a measured length shorter than the extracted length field (as indicated by bytes 13 and 14 in a non-VLAN tagged frame) to be discarded. This only applies to frames with a length field less than 0x0600.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive buffer offset - indicates the number of bytes by which the received data is offset from the start of the receive buffer.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause enable - when set, transmission will pause if a non zero 802.3 classic pause frame is received and PFC has not been negotiated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Retry test - must be set to zero for normal operation. If set to one the backoff between collisions will always be one slot time. Setting this bit to one helps test the too many retries condition. Also used in the pause frame tests to reduce the pause counter's decrement time from 512 bit times, to every rx_clk cycle.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: NA 0: GMII/MII interface enabled, TBI disabled 1: TBI enabled, GMII/MII disabled

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Gigabit mode enable - setting this bit configures the GEM for 1000 Mbps operation. 0: 10/100 operation using MII or TBI interface 1: Gigabit operation using GMII or TBI interface

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: External address match enable - when set the external address match interface can be used to copy frames to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive 1536 byte frames - setting this bit means the GEM will accept frames up to 1536 bytes in length. Normally the GEM would reject any frame above 1518 bytes.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Unicast hash enable - when set, unicast frames will be accepted when the 6 bit hash function of the destination address points to a bit that is set in the hash register.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multicast hash enable - when set, multicast frames will be accepted when the 6 bit hash function of the destination address points to a bit that is set in the hash register.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: No broadcast - when set to logic one, frames addressed to the broadcast address of all ones will not be accepted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Copy all frames - when set to logic one, all valid frames will be accepted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Discard non-VLAN frames - when set only VLAN tagged frames will be passed to the address matching logic.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Full duplex - if set to logic one, the transmit block ignores the state of collision and carrier sense and allows receive while transmitting. Also controls the half-duplex pin.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Speed - set to logic one to indicate 100Mbps operation, logic zero for 10Mbps. The value of this pin is reflected on the speed_mode[0] output pin.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Network Status

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Set when PFC Priority Based Pause has been negotiated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The PHY management logic is idle (i.e. has completed).

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Returns status of the mdio_in pin

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: User IO (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: DMA Configuration

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: When set, the GEM DMA will automatically discard receive packets from the receiver packet buffer memory when no AHB resource is available. When low, then received packets will remain to be stored in the SRAM based packet buffer until AHB buffer resource next becomes available.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: DMA receive buffer size in AHB system memory. The value defined by these bits determines the size of buffer to use in main AHB system memory when writing received data. The value is defined in multiples of 64 bytes such that a value of 0x01 corresponds to buffers of 64 bytes, 0x02 corresponds to 128 bytes etc. For example: 0x02: 128 byte 0x18: 1536 byte (1*max length frame/buffer) 0xA0: 10240 byte (1*10k jumbo frame/buffer) Note that this value should never be written as zero.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmitter IP, TCP and UDP checksum generation offload enable. When set, the transmitter checksum generation engine is enabled, to calculate and substitute checksums for transmit frames. When clear, frame data is unaffected. If the GEM is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, this bit is not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Zynq uses packet buffer.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmitter packet buffer memory size select - Having this bit at zero halves the amount of memory used for the transmit packet buffer. This reduces the amount of memory used by the GEM. It is important to set this bit to one if the full configured physical memory is available. The value in brackets below represents the size that would result for the default maximum configured memory size of 4 kB. 1: Use full configured addressable space (4 kB) 0: Do not use top address bit (2 kB) If the GEM is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, this bit is not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Zynq uses packet buffer.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receiver packet buffer memory size select - Having these bits at less than 11 reduces the amount of memory used for the receive packet buffer. This reduces the amount of memory used by the GEM. It is important to set these bits both to one if the full configured physical memory is available. The value in brackets below represents the size that would result for the default maximum configured memory size of 8 kBs. 00: Do not use top three address bits (1 kB) 01: Do not use top two address bits (2 kB) 10: Do not use top address bit (4 kB) 11: Use full configured addressable space (8 kB) If the controller is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, these bits are not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Zynq uses packet buffer.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: AHB endian swap mode enable for packet data accesses - When set, selects swapped endianism for AHB transfers. When clear, selects little endian mode.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: AHB endian swap mode enable for management descriptor accesses - When set, selects swapped endianism for AHB transfers. When clear, selects little endian mode.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: AHB fixed burst length for DMA data operations - Selects the burst length to attempt to use on the AHB when transferring frame data. Not used for DMA management operations and only used where space and data size allow. Otherwise SINGLE type AHB transfers are used. Upper bits become non-writeable if the configured DMA TX and RX FIFO sizes are smaller than required to support the selected burst size. One-hot priority encoding enforced automatically on register writes as follows, where 'x' represents don't care: 00001: Always use SINGLE AHB bursts 0001x: Always use SINGLE AHB bursts 001xx: Attempt to use INCR4 AHB bursts (default) 01xxx: Attempt to use INCR8 AHB bursts 1xxxx: Attempt to use INCR16 AHB bursts others: reserved

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit Status

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Late collision occurred - only set if the condition occurs in gigabit mode, as retry is not attempted. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit under run - this bit is set if the transmitter was forced to terminate a frame that it had already began transmitting due to further data being unavailable. This bit is set if a transmitter status write back has not completed when another status write back is attempted. When using the DMA interface configured for internal FIFO mode, this bit is also set when the transmit DMA has written the SOP data into the FIFO and either the AHB bus was not granted in time for further data, or because an AHB not OK response was returned, or because a used bit was read. When using the DMA interface configured for packet buffer mode, this bit will never be set. When using the external FIFO interface, this bit is also set when the tx_r_underflow input is asserted during a frame transfer. Cleared by writing a 1.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit complete - set when a frame has been transmitted. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error - set if an error occurs whilst midway through reading transmit frame from the AHB, including HRESP errors and buffers exhausted mid frame (if the buffers run out during transmission of a frame then transmission stops, FCS shall be bad and tx_er asserted). Also set in DMA packet buffer mode if single frame is too large for configured packet buffer memory size. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit go - if high transmit is active. When using the exposed FIFO interface, this bit represents bit 3 of the network control register. When using the DMA interface this bit represents the tx_go variable as specified in the transmit buffer description.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Retry limit exceeded - cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Collision occurred - set by the assertion of collision. Cleared by writing a one to this bit. When operating in 10/100 mode, this status indicates either a collision or a late collision. In gigabit mode, this status is not set for a late collision.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Used bit read - set when a transmit buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive Buffer Queue Base Address

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive buffer queue base address - written with the address of the start of the receive queue.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit Buffer Queue Base Address

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit buffer queue base address - written with the address of the start of the transmit queue.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive Status

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive overrun - this bit is set if either the gem_dma RX FIFO or external RX FIFO were unable to store the receive frame due to a FIFO overflow, or if the receive status, reported by the gem_rx module to the gem_dma was not taken at end of frame. This bit is also set in DMA packet buffer mode if the packet buffer overflows. For DMA operation the buffer will be recovered if an overrun occurs. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frame received - one or more frames have been received and placed in memory. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Buffer not available - an attempt was made to get a new buffer and the pointer indicated that it was owned by the processor. The DMA will reread the pointer each time an end of frame is received until a valid pointer is found. This bit is set following each descriptor read attempt that fails, even if consecutive pointers are unsuccessful and software has in the mean time cleared the status flag. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Interrupt Status

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: TSU seconds register increment - indicates the register has incremented.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted - indicates a PTP pdelay_resp frame has been transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted - indicates a PTP pdelay_req frame has been transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_resp frame received - indicates a PTP pdelay_resp frame has been received.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_req frame received - indicates a PTP pdelay_req frame has been received.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP sync frame transmitted - indicates a PTP sync frame has been transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP delay_req frame transmitted - indicates a PTP delay_req frame has been transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP sync frame received - indicates a PTP sync frame has been received.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP delay_req frame received - indicates a PTP delay_req frame has been received.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: External interrupt - set when a rising edge has been detected on the ext_interrupt_in input pin.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause frame transmitted - indicates a pause frame has been successfully transmitted after being initiated from the network control register or from the tx_pause control pin.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause time zero - set when either the pause time register at address 0x38 decrements to zero, or when a valid pause frame is received with a zero pause quantum field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause frame with non-zero pause quantum received - indicates a valid pause has been received that has a non-zero pause quantum field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive overrun - set when the receive overrun status bit gets set.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit complete - set when a frame has been transmitted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error - set if an error occurs while midway through reading transmit frame from the AHB, including HRESP errors and buffers exhausted mid frame (if the buffers run out during transmission of a frame then transmission stops, FCS shall be bad and tx_er asserted). Also set in DMA packet buffer mode if single frame is too large for configured packet buffer memory size. Cleared on a read.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Retry limit exceeded or late collision - transmit error. Late collision will only cause this status bit to be set in gigabit mode (as a retry is not attempted).

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: TX used bit read - set when a transmit buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: RX used bit read - set when a receive buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive complete - a frame has been stored in memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Management frame sent - the PHY maintenance register has completed its operation.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Interrupt Enable

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable TSU seconds register increment interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP pdelay_resp frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP pdelay_req frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP sync frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP delay_req frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP sync frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable PTP delay_req frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable external interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable pause frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable pause time zero interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable hresp not OK interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable receive overrun interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable link change interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable transmit complete interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable retry limit exceeded or late collision interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable transmit buffer under run interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable transmit used bit read interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable receive used bit read interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable receive complete interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable management done interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Interrupt Disable

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable TSU seconds register increment interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP pdelay_resp frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP pdelay_req frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP sync frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP delay_req frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP sync frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable PTP delay_req frame received interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable external interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable pause frame transmitted interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable pause time zero interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable hresp not OK interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable receive overrun interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable link change interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable transmit complete interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable retry limit exceeded or late collision interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable transmit buffer under run interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable transmit used bit read interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable receive used bit read interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable receive complete interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Disable management done interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Interrupt Mask Status

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_resp frame received mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP pdelay_req frame received mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP sync frame transmitted mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP delay_req frame transmitted mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP sync frame received mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP delay_req frame received mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: External interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause frame transmitted interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause time zero interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hresp not OK interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive overrun interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Link change interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit complete interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Retry limit exceeded or late collision (gigabit mode only)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit buffer under run interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit used bit read interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive used bit read interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive complete interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Management done interrupt mask.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PHY Maintenance

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Must be written to 1 for Clause 22 operation. Check your PHY's spec to see if it is clause 22 or clause 45 compliant.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Operation. 10 is read. 01 is write.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PHY address.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Register address - specifies the register in the PHY to access.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Must be written to 10.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: For a write operation this is written with the data to be written to the PHY. After a read operation this contains the data read from the PHY.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Received Pause Quantum

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Received pause quantum - stores the current value of the received pause quantum register which is decremented every 512 bit times.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit Pause Quantum

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit pause quantum - written with the pause quantum value for pause frame transmission.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: GEM Jumbo Max Length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hash Register Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Hash Register Top [63:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 1 Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 1 Top [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific address 1. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 2 Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 2 Top [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific address 2. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 3 Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 3 Top [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific address 3. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 4 Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address 4 Top [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific address 4. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID Match 1

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable copying of type ID match 1 matched frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID match 1. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID Match 2

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable copying of type ID match 2 matched frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID match 2. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID Match 3

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable copying of type ID match 3 matched frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID match 3. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID Match 4

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable copying of type ID match 4 matched frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Type ID match 4. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN Register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN multicast hash event enable. When set multicast hash events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN specific address register 1 event enable. When set specific address 1 events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN ARP request event enable. When set ARP request events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN magic packet event enable. When set magic packet events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Wake on LAN ARP request IP address. Written to define the least significant 16 bits of the target IP address that is matched to generate a Wake on LAN event. A value of zero will not generate an event, even if this is matched by the received frame.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: IPG stretch register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Bits 7:0 are multiplied with the previously transmitted frame length (including preamble) bits 15:8 +1 divide the frame length. If the resulting number is greater than 96 and bit 28 is set in the network configuration register then the resulting number is used for the transmit inter-packet-gap. 1 is added to bits 15:8 to prevent a divide by zero.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Stacked VLAN Register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Enable Stacked VLAN processing mode

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: User defined VLAN_TYPE field. When Stacked VLAN is enabled, the first VLAN tag in a received frame will only be accepted if the VLAN type field is equal to this user defined VLAN_TYPE OR equal to the standard VLAN type (0x8100). Note that the second VLAN tag of a Stacked VLAN packet will only be matched correctly if its VLAN_TYPE field equals 0x8100.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit PFC Pause Register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: If bit 17 of the network control register is written with a one then for each entry equal to zero in the Transmit PFC Pause Register[15:8], the PFC pause frame's pause quantum field associated with that entry will be taken from the transmit pause quantum register. For each entry equal to one in the Transmit PFC Pause Register [15:8], the pause quantum associated with that entry will be zero.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address Mask 1 Bottom [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Specific Address Mask 1 Top [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP RX Unicast address (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP TX Unicast address (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Module ID

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Module identification number - for the GEM, this value is fixed at 0x0002.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Octets transmitted [31:0] (in frames without error)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Octets transmitted [47:32] (in frames without error)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Transmitted

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully transmitted, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Broadcast frames Tx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Broadcast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multicast frames Tx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multicast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause frames Tx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmitted pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames transmitted. Only pause frames triggered by the register interface or through the external pause pins are counted as pause frames. Pause frames received through the external FIFO interface are counted in the frames transmitted counter.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Tx, 64-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 64 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Tx, 65 to 127-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 65 to127 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to127 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Tx, 128 to 255-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 128 to 255 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Tx, 256 to 511-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 256 to 511 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Tx, 512 to 1023-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 512 to 1023 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frame Tx, 1024 to 1518-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1024 to 1518 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frame Tx, 1519+byte length (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit under runs

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Transmit under runs - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames not transmitted due to a transmit under run. If this register is incremented then no other statistics register is incremented.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Single Collision Frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Single collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing a single collision before being successfully transmitted, i.e. no under run.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multiple Collision Frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multiple collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing between two and fifteen collisions prior to being successfully transmitted, i.e., no under run and not too many retries.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Excessive Collisions

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Excessive collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that failed to be transmitted because they experienced 16 collisions.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Late Collisions

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Late collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of late collision occurring after the slot time (512 bits) has expired. In 10/100 mode, late collisions are counted twice i.e., both as a collision and a late collision. In gigabit mode, a late collision causes the transmission to be aborted, thus the single and multi collision registers are not updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Deferred Transmission Frames

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Deferred transmission frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing deferral due to carrier sense being active on their first attempt at transmission. Frames involved in any collision are not counted nor are frames that experienced a transmit under run.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Carrier Sense Errors.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Carrier sense errors - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames transmitted where carrier sense was not seen during transmission or where carrier sense was deasserted after being asserted in a transmit frame without collision (no under run). Only incremented in half duplex mode. The only effect of a carrier sense error is to increment this register. The behavior of the other statistics registers is unaffected by the detection of a carrier sense error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Octets Received [31:0]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Received octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Octets Received [47:32]

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Received octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Received

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully received. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Broadcast Frames Rx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Broadcast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multicast Frames Rx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Multicast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Pause Frames Rx

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Received pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames received without error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 64-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 64 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 65 to 127-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 65 to 127 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to 127 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 128 to 255-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 128 to 255 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 256 to 511-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 256 to 511 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 512 to 1023-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 512 to 1023 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 1024 to 1518-byte length

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1024 to 1518 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frames Rx, 1519+byte length (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Undersize frames received

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Undersize frames received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received less than 64 bytes in length (10/100 mode or gigabit mode, full duplex) that do not have either a CRC error or an alignment error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Oversize frames received

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Oversize frames received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received exceeding 1518 bytes (1536 bytes if bit 8 is set in network configuration register) in length but do not have either a CRC error, an alignment error nor a receive symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Jabbers received

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Jabbers received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received exceeding 1518 bytes (1536 if bit 8 set in network configuration register) in length and have either a CRC error, an alignment error or a receive symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frame check sequence errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Frame check sequence errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are an integral number of bytes, have bad CRC and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and has an integral number of bytes. This register is incremented for a frame with bad FCS, regardless of whether it is copied to memory due to ignore FCS mode being enabled in bit 26 of the network configuration register.H524

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Length field frame errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Length field frame errors - this 10-bit register counts the number of frames received that have a measured length shorter than that extracted from the length field (bytes 13 and 14). This condition is only counted if the value of the length field is less than 0x0600, the frame is not of excessive length and checking is enabled through bit 16 of the network configuration register.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive symbol errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive symbol errors - a 10-bit register counting the number of frames that had rx_er asserted during reception. For 10/100 mode symbol errors are counted regardless of frame length checks. For gigabit mode the frame must satisfy slot time requirements in order to count a symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Alignment errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Alignment errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are not an integral number of bytes long and have bad CRC when their length is truncated to an integral number of bytes and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and does not have an integral number of bytes.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive resource errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive resource errors - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames that were successfully received by the MAC (correct address matched frame and adequate slot time) but could not be copied to memory because no receive buffer was available. This will be either because the AHB bus was not granted in time or because a hresp not OK was returned.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive overrun errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Receive overruns - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that are address recognized but were not copied to memory due to a receive overrun.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: IP header checksum errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 0 IP header checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect IP header checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: TCP checksum errors

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: TCP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect TCP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: UDP checksum error

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: UDP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect UDP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer sync strobe seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The value of the Timer Seconds register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer sync strobe nanoseconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The value of the Timer Nanoseconds register

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Timer count in seconds. This register is writeable. It increments by one when the 1588 nanoseconds counter counts to one second. It may also be incremented when the timer adjust register is written.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer nanoseconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Timer count in nanoseconds. This register is writeable. It can also be adjusted by writes to the 1588 timer adjust register. It increments by the value of the 1588 timer increment register each clock cycle.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer adjust

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Write as one to subtract from the 1588 timer. Write as zero to add to it.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The number of nanoseconds to increment or decrement the 1588 timer nanoseconds register. If necessary, the 1588 seconds register will be incremented or decremented.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: 1588 timer increment

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The number of increments after which the alternative increment is used.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Alternative count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: A count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP event frame transmitted seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP event frame transmitted nanoseconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP event frame received seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP event frame received nanoseconds.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP peer event frame transmitted seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP peer event frame transmitted nanoseconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP peer event frame received seconds

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: PTP peer event frame received nanoseconds.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Design Configuration 1 (Not in TRM)

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Design Configuration 2

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Tx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer). Buffer size for Tx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Rx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer). Buffer size for Rx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Zynq. Includes the transmitter packet buffer

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Zynq. Includes the receiver packet buffer.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_hprot_value DEFINE. For Zynq, set the fixed AHB HPROT value used during transfers.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_jumbo_max_length DEFINE. Maximum length of jumbo frames accepted by receiver. This is set to the size of the smallest of the two packet buffer, minus a margin for packet headers. However, Zynq will not support jumbo frames.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Design Configuration 3

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_rx_fifo_size

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small Rx FIFO for grant latency. Extended to 16 deep to allow buffering of 64 byte maximum AHB burst size in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Design Configuration 4

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_tx_fifo_size.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small TX FIFO for grant latency

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Design Configuration 5

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tsu_clk DEFINE. Undefined in Zynq. 1588 Time Stamp Unit clock sourced from pclk rather than independent tsu_clk.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_buffer_length_def DEFINE. Set the default buffer length used by Rx DMA to 128 bytes.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Tx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Rx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_endian_swap_def DEFINE. Set to big endian data, little endian management descriptors in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_mdc_clock_div DEFINE. Set default MDC clock divisor (can still be programmed) in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_dma_bus_width_def DEFINE. Limit to 32-bit AHB bus in Zynq.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_phy_ident DEFINE. Undefined in Zynq. Only used in PCS.

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_tsu DEFINE. Defined in Zynq. Include support for 1588 Time Stamp Unit.

doctext.name: txt

doctext.name: txt
doctext.text: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_fifo_cnt_width DEFINE. Width for `gem_rx_fifo_size.
